issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Testing Infrastructure
components.description: Tracks issues with tests and testing infrastructure.

fields.description: ant test succeeded with "Apache Ant version 1.6.5 compiled on June 2 2005", but fails with apache-ant-1.7.1.
fields.summary: ant test will fail with apache-ant-1.7.1

comments.body:
hadoop trunk requires apache-ant-1.7.1 now (i tried ant 1.6.5 and it does not work any more).
It's better to make hive also compile under the same ant version.

[junit] Running org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.TestAlter
    [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec

    [junit] Running org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.TestTruncate
    [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec
Can you run ant with debug. That output might help us nail this down.
